result.execSummary:
All charges against Randarius L Keys in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randarius L Keys is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randarius L Keys

Case called at 10:09 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Randarius L Keys in court, in custody at MSDF by zoom, with attorney J Andrew Herbers by phone.
Victim appeared in court in person.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Herbers rquests that the No Contact provision be lifted or be modified to No Violent Contact.
Victim makes statements.  State objects.
Court will Modify the Conditions of Bail  to allow contact with Victim A.  Defendant is not allowed to discuss the case with Victim A.
Attorney Herbers requests that the case be placed on the trial calendar.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
